description:
ACS CLI is a tool for managing Splunk cloud stacks which can be used to perform common administrative tasks without assistance from Splunk support.

Admin Config Service CLI for managing Splunk cloud stacks. ACS is a cloud-native API that provides programmatic self-service administration capabilities for Splunk Cloud Platform. Splunk Cloud Platform administrators can use the ACS CLI to perform common administrative tasks without assistance from Splunk Support.
- The new acs ip-allowlist-v6 describe subcommand adds support to list the ipv6 subnets for a specific allowlist feature.
- The new acs ip-allowlist-v6 create subcommand adds support to create the ipv6 subnets for a specific allowlist feature.
- The new acs ip-allowlist-v6 delete subcommand adds support to delete the ipv6 subnets for a specific allowlist feature.
- The new acs outbound-port-v6 describe subcommand adds support to list the allowed ipv6 subnets for a given outbound port.
- The new acs outbound-port-v6 list subcommand adds support to list all ipv6 subnets for all outbound ports.
- The new acs outbound-port-v6 create subcommand adds support to create the ipv6 subnets for a given outbound port.
- The new acs outbound-port-v6 delete subcommand adds support to delete the ipv6 subnets for a given outbound port.
